question_text: Premise: p ∨ (q ∧ r), ¬p, (q ∧ r) → ¬s. Which of the following conclusions can be validly derived?
Target formula: q ∧ r. Which of the following is logically equivalent to it?
Target formula: q ∧ p. Which of the following is logically equivalent to it?
Given assignment α: p=F, r=T. Determine whether (p ↔ p) ∧ r is true under this assignment.
Target formula: ¬((q → q) → (q → p)). Which of the following formulas are logically equivalent to it?
Select all formulas that are not equivalent to ¬((p ↔ p) ∧ (s → p)).
Select the assignment under which p ∧ q holds.
Choose the option that satisfies r ∧ q.
Premise: p → (¬q → r), p, ¬q. Which conclusions are not logically entailed?
Are (r → q) ∧ (r → r) and ¬(q ∧ r) ∧ (r → r) equivalent under all assignments?
Select the formula that is equivalent to ¬(¬r → ¬q).
Which formulas yield the same truth values as ((p → r) ↔ (p ∨ q)) ↔ r in every case?
Select the assignment under which (r → p) ↔ (p → q) holds.
Evaluate q ∨ p with assignment p=T, q=T: true or false?
Premise: p ↔ ¬q, p. Which conclusion can be correctly inferred?
Conclusion: ¬p ∨ ¬q. Given Premise: p → (q → (r ∨ s)), p, q. Evaluate whether the inference is valid.
Select the assignment under which q ∧ p holds.
Choose the option that satisfies p ∧ q.
Target formula: (p → r) ∨ (q → q). Which of the following formulas are logically equivalent to it?
Evaluate whether q ∨ p is logically equivalent to ¬(q ∨ p).
Given assignment α: p=F, q=T. Determine whether q → p is true under this assignment.
Decide whether the following two formulas are logically equivalent: (p ∨ q) ∧ (p → r) and (p ∨ ¬q) ∧ ¬(r → p).
Which of the following assignments make the formula s ∧ ((r ∨ s) → (q ∧ r)) false?
Select all formulas equivalent to r ∨ q.
Select the formula that is not logically equivalent to r ∨ p.
Premise: ¬¬p ∨ (q ∨ r), (s ∨ ¬q) ∧ (s ∨ ¬r), ¬s. Select the conclusion that follows logically.
Which option has the same truth values as (p ∧ q) ∨ (p ∧ q) under all assignments?
Premise: (p → q) ∧ (q → p). Which of the following conclusions cannot be derived?
Premise: p → (q ∨ r), (¬q ∧ ¬r) ∨ s, ¬s; Conclusion: q. Is this inference valid?
Premise: p → (q ∧ r), (¬q ∨ ¬r) ∨ s, p. Which option is not a valid inference?
Premise: ((p → (q ∨ r)) ∧ (¬q ∧ ¬r)) ∨ ((p → (q ∨ r)) ∧ p). Which option is not a valid inference?
Target formula: ((p ↔ s) ↔ (r → r)) ∨ ¬(s ∨ s). Which of the following formulas are logically equivalent to it?
Which formulas differ in truth values from q ∨ p?
Premise: p ∧ ¬q. Which of the following conclusions can be validly derived?
Evaluate whether (q ↔ q) → ¬p is logically equivalent to ((¬q ∨ q) ∧ (q → q)) → ¬p.
Target formula: (r ∨ s) → (s ∨ r). Which of the following formulas are logically equivalent to it?
Select the assignment under which p ∧ q holds.
Premise: ¬p → ((q ∨ r) → s), ¬p, q ∨ r. Which conclusions are not logically entailed?
Which of the following assignments make the formula q ∧ (¬s ∨ (p ∧ q)) true?
Select the assignment under which (s ↔ q) ∧ (q ∨ p) holds.
Which option has the same truth values as q → p under all assignments?
Which formulas yield the same truth values as (r → q) ↔ (r ∨ r) in every case?
Choose the option that causes p → q to evaluate to false.
Under α = p=F, q=T, is the formula q → p satisfied?
Which option has the same truth values as q ∧ p under all assignments?
Select the formula that is equivalent to p ↔ q.
Given assignment α: p=F, q=T. Determine whether p ∧ q is true under this assignment.
Select all assignments that satisfy (r → p) ∨ (q ∧ p).
Given assignment α: q=T, r=F, s=F. Determine whether ((q ↔ q) ∨ s) ↔ ¬(s ∨ r) is true under this assignment.
Premise: p ↔ ¬q, ((¬q → r) ∧ ¬r) ∨ ((¬q → r) ∧ ¬q). Which conclusions are not logically entailed?
Are (¬r ∨ (s ↔ p)) ∧ ((r ↔ p) ∨ (r → q)) and (¬r ∧ (s ↔ p)) ∧ ¬((r ↔ ¬p) ∨ (r → q)) equivalent under all assignments?
Evaluate whether (p ∧ r) ↔ p is logically equivalent to (¬¬(p ∧ r) → p) ∧ (p → ¬¬(p ∧ r)).
Premise: p → (q → r), p, q. Does the Conclusion: ¬q follow logically?
Target formula: (¬s → ¬s) ∧ (r → (q ∧ p)). Which of the following is not equivalent to it?
Target formula: p ∧ (q ↔ q). Which of the following formulas are logically equivalent to it?
Conclusion: ¬s ∧ q. Given Premise: p → (¬(q ∨ r) ∨ s), p, q ∨ r. Evaluate whether the inference is valid.
Which of the following assignments makes the formula p ∧ q true?
Target formula: ¬(q ∧ s) ↔ ¬(r ∨ p). Which of the following are not equivalent to it?
Target formula: ¬((s ∨ q) ∧ (p ↔ r)). Which of the following are not equivalent to it?
Evaluate whether p ∨ (r ∧ r) is logically equivalent to ¬¬(p ∨ r) ∧ (p ∨ r).
Given assignment α: p=T, q=F. Determine whether (q ∧ q) ↔ (p ↔ p) is true under this assignment.
Premise: ¬p → (q ∧ r), ((¬q ∨ ¬r) ∨ s) ∧ ((¬q ∨ ¬r) ∨ t), (s ∧ t) → (u ∨ v), ¬(u ∨ v). Which of the following conclusions cannot be derived?
Premise: p ↔ q, ((q → r) ∧ ¬r) ∨ ((q → r) ∧ q), (r → (s ∧ t)) ∧ (¬(s ∧ t) ∨ r). Which of the following conclusions can be validly derived?
Are (q ∧ p) → ¬p and ¬¬((q ∧ p) → ¬p) equivalent under all assignments?
Premise: ¬p ∨ ¬q, ¬¬q ∨ (r ∧ s), (r ∧ s) → (t ∧ u), p. Which conclusions are logically entailed?
Which formulas differ in truth values from (q ↔ p) ∧ ¬p?
Choose the option that satisfies ((p ∨ r) ∨ (p → r)) ∧ ((s → p) ∧ ¬p).
Are q ↔ s and ¬¬((q → s) ∧ (s → q)) equivalent under all assignments?
Decide whether the following two formulas are logically equivalent: p → r and ¬p → r.
Premise: p ∧ ¬q. Does the Conclusion: ¬p follow logically?
Which of the following assignments make the formula (p ↔ q) → (p ∧ r) true?
Select all assignments that satisfy p ↔ q.
Decide whether the following two formulas are logically equivalent: p ↔ q and (p → ¬¬q) ∧ (q → p).
Target formula: q → p. Which of the following is logically equivalent to it?
Premise: p ∧ ¬q. Does the Conclusion: ¬q follow logically?
Evaluate whether q → p is logically equivalent to q → ¬¬p.
Target formula: (r → p) ∨ ¬q. Which of the following is logically equivalent to it?
Given assignment α: p=F, q=T, r=T. Determine whether p ↔ ((p ∧ r) ∨ (r ∨ q)) is true under this assignment.
Target formula: p → q. Which of the following is logically equivalent to it?
Select all formulas equivalent to p ↔ q.
Select all assignments under which ((p → s) ∨ (q → s)) → (¬p ↔ (r → s)) fails.
Given assignment α: p=T, q=F, r=F, s=F. Determine whether ((p ↔ s) ∧ (p ∨ q)) → (¬p ↔ (p ∧ r)) is true under this assignment.
Which of the following assignments make the formula p → s true?
Evaluate whether p ↔ q is logically equivalent to (¬¬p → q) ∧ (q → p).

Select the assignment under which r ∧ q holds.
Select the formula that is not logically equivalent to ¬(r → q) ∧ s.
Premise: (p → (q ∨ r)) ∧ ((q ∨ r) → p). Which conclusion can be correctly inferred?
Which option has the same truth values as q ∧ p under all assignments?
Select all formulas equivalent to s → (p ∨ r).
Which of the following assignments makes the formula (r ∧ r) ∨ (q ∧ p) true?
Premise: ¬p ∧ ¬q. Which of the following conclusions can be validly derived?
Under which of these assignments does q ↔ ¬p evaluate to true?
Conclusion: ¬¬p. Given Premise: ¬p → (q → ¬r), ¬p, q. Evaluate whether the inference is valid.
Are (p ∨ q) ↔ (q ↔ p) and (p ∨ ¬q) → (q ↔ p) equivalent under all assignments?
Which of the following assignments makes the formula (¬q ↔ r) ↔ p false?

Under α = p=T, q=F, is the formula q ↔ p satisfied?

Select all assignments under which ¬(q ↔ p) fails.
Under α = p=F, q=T, is the formula p → q satisfied?

Choose the option that satisfies q ∧ p.
Under which of these assignments does ¬(s ∨ q) ↔ ¬(s ∨ r) evaluate to false?
Select all assignments that satisfy ¬((p ↔ s) ↔ (q ∨ p)).

Select all formulas equivalent to ¬r ∧ (r ↔ s).

Select the formula that is equivalent to p ∨ q.
